Description: Bronze miniature lamp with an elongated carinated body, a wide filling-hole, and a flaring round-tipped nozzle, broken at its end, with an oval wick-hole. At the rear is a ring handle, much lost. The lamp stands on a flat pointed-oval resting-surface.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir Charles Thomas Newton
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3806)
